conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a cutaway 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible interior volumes, and an elevated/isometric-like viewpoint exposing interior spaces.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clear wall thickness and room volumes; clean cutaway. Minor simplicity in corner/edge detailing and some openings look less explicitly modeled.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall 3BHK layout reads similarly (central living/dining, bedrooms around, kitchen zone), but several boundaries/openings and balcony/utility articulation appear simplified or shifted relative to the 2D plan, reducing strict fidelity.

interior_elements.notes: Beds and sofas present; dining/living furniture present; bathrooms appear to have some fixtures but are not fully clear; kitchen elements are simplified and not fully verifiable from this view.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable walls/floors and clean presentation with minimal artifacts; lighting is adequate though some rooms/openings are hard to verify due to uniform materials and camera angle.

detected_errors.description: Some room boundary positions/proportions and circulation widths appear simplified/shifted compared to the 2D plan (not a strict 1:1 geometric match).
Door/window placement and/or opening sizes are not fully consistent/confirmable with the 2D plan; several openings are simplified in the 3D model.
Kitchen and bathroom fixtures are simplified, making exact room identity verification less certain in a few areas.

summary: This is a true cutaway 3D conversion with solid spatial readability, but strict geometric fidelity to the 2D plan is weakened by simplified/shifted partitions and less exact door/window/balcony detailing.
